intro: Acrocentron tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leafed acrocentron, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
